verdict: By The American Diabetes Association, this mouthwatering cookbook shows that having diabetes doesnâ€™t mean you must give up your favorite comfort foods.
pros: Focuses on recreating beloved dishes using sugar substitutes and portion control
Examples include cheddar baked potato skins, pork quesadillas, and taco salad
cons: Some sweet recipes include limited amounts of sugar or honey

all_review.title: Don't waste your money.
all_review.text: Read the one and two star reviews before buying, they are right about this book. Almost all of these recipes have sugar in the nutritional values - some of them have 12g to 17g of sugar (some recipes include brown sugar)! If these meals were packaged and on the shelves at my grocery store, I'd read the nutritional value (like most diabetics do) and immediately put it right back on the shelf - why would I want the recipe?!?! I'm so disappointed!

all_review.title: Don't know how they can call themselves a diabetic book ...
all_review.text: Don't know how they can call themselves a diabetic book. Flour? Sugar? Two things diabetics try to avoid. I wish I had paid more attention to the other reviewers and not bought this book.

all_review.title: Poor choice for a diabetic
all_review.text: Diabetics looking for low carb alternatives need to look elsewhere. All of the recipes are extremely carb heavy (many 20-30g per serving). The author starts focusing on low fat and low calorie which really isn't as significant of a factor for diabetics. None of the recipes are actually significantly different that what you could find in any cookbook since they don't even bother to be low-carbohydrate alternatives. There are no recipes in this book that I will use.

all_review.title: A Serious Cook Book Fan
all_review.text: So far so good. I like the content and it is easy to read. Perfect for a new diabetic who likes comfort food. Thanks for breaking down the nutritional facts especially regarding carbs. This Southern thinks the book is invaluable. Great pics are a plus.

all_review.title: Delicious!
all_review.text: There are a lot of really good recipes in this book. As a prediabetic I was comforted and amazed at the variety of foods that one is allowed to eat. My only objection is that the recipes are always for six or eight servings, so I have to figure out how to cut the amounts down for one person.

all_review.title: Not what I was looking for.
all_review.text: This is probably a great book for people who don't associate the word "Comfort" with just plain home cooking. It certainly has some great sounding recipes, but not the type of food I call "comfort food." Probably because I'm from the South, and we look at comfort food as entirely different from what this book calls "Comfort" food. I'm sure other people would find wonderful recipes in this book; I'm definitely NOT saying it is a bad book.....just not what I am looking for.

all_review.title: Great recipes for gestational diabetes.
all_review.text: I had to buy a cookbook that I actually would use for comfort food while I was pregnant. I have Type 2 diabetes, and I was instructed that I couldn't gain more than 10 pounds during my whole pregnancy, and that I would have to work especially hard to keep my sugars low. I did it! It was hard, but being able to eat comfort food that didn't shoot me over my goal sugars, was wonderful. It's an easy to use book, and I love cookbooks, so it wasn't so hard to immerse myself in it. User friendly, and pregnancy friendly.

all_review.title: A great asset for everybody, not just the Diabetic.
all_review.text: Good tasting recipes that are clear and easy to make. Clear breakdown of Carbs, sugars, calories, etc. as well exchanges. Not only for the Diabetic but also for those wanting to eat more healthy and wanting to drop a few pounds.

all_review.title: Yum, and more
all_review.text: The ADA Comfort Food Cookbook really lives up to it's name. So many recipes to try, and they all looked so good I didn't know where to start. so I started with the first recipe, (really good, and we both loved the wanton bundles). Since then I have tried several other recipes and they have all been delicious and easy to cook. Real comfort food that fiuts into our diabetic diets. i would recommend this cookbook to anyone, whether they have diabetes or not. It is good for the whole family, and the kids will love lots of the recipes.

all_review.title: Helps to stop punishing him!
all_review.text: I was VERY discouraged by all the other diabetes cookbooks I'd ordered, after my 71 yr. old husbands diagnosis 3 mo. ago! This is the ONLY one with recipes that actually are appealing, and don't make him feel like he's being punished! Frankly...I'm tempted to write my OWN cookbook for newly diagnosed diabetes 2 patients, because there is a SERIOUS need for it, and let's get real: Diabetes in America is now an epidemic due to the bad diets our Food industry has gotten us into!

all_review.title: A MUST HAVE book! Learning proper foods and food ...
all_review.text: A MUST HAVE book! Learning proper foods and food ideas was my biggest problem. Being a newly diagnosed Type 2 diabetic, this book really helps me in meal planning.

all_review.title: we like this cookbook
all_review.text: I have tried more of these recipes. Have found a lot of good easy good tasting recipes that we liked so well have made them several times. My husband always wanted my old recipes never wanting or liking new. After eating some recipes from this book he said I don't want to hurt your feelings I like you'd cooking but these meals I look forward to always something new . Figure that out!! He is not going hungry at all like so many diets.

all_review.title: this cookbook has been great. Just when you thought you couldn't have your ...
all_review.text: Being new to diabetes, this cookbook has been great. Just when you thought you couldn't have your favorites, you find them in here and can be sure you're not killing yourself by indulging. We bought a bunch of diabetic cookbooks, and so far we like this one the best.

all_review.title: There is good food after a diabetes diagnosis
all_review.text: A family member was recently diagnosed with diabetes and this comfort food cookbook was so handy. They felt like the diagnosis was a life sentence of horrible blah food and this cookbook showed them it's possible to still have the things you love with just a few tweaks! Lifesaver!

all_review.title: Five Stars
all_review.text: this is my favorite of the two I ordered because my husband loves the recipes,comfort food being his favorite!

all_review.title: Awesome recipes and simple to make
all_review.text: My grandpa was recently diagnosed with diabetes and he also has high blood pressure so he was definitely worried about what he could and could not eat. So I purchased this for him and he LOVES IT. He was so excited to see that he could still eat the foods he loved, with some adjustments of course. Theres awesome recipes in there that he has always loved to eat and the instructions are simple to make them. It also tells you the calorie intake and everything. Im very happy that I came across this. Would recommend it to others

all_review.title: Great book for controlling diabetes.
all_review.text: Great book for those who want to control their diabetes or loose waite to become or stay healthy.

all_review.title: Another diabetes cookbook
all_review.text: Some good tips on losing weight to better control diabetes. Nothing exciting about the recipes included herein. Useful as a reference when reminders are needed. Guess I expected some helpful revelations and recipes from what I thought was the be-all-and-end-all of diabetes info. Felt it was the standard, usual stuff found in other such books... Only made one recipe from the book.

all_review.title: Great recipes !
all_review.text: The only diabetic cookbook so far that is not a waste of money ! What would you think if i said that you can have a baked potato soup that is also healthy? Well, you can and it's got the recipe. Also has all the carbs and facts counted for you. Great cookbook for real world cooking. Also has some "world cooking" recipes that sound great. The book is not a rectangle though like the picture...it is a perfect square.

all_review.title: Comfort Food Cookbook for Diabetics

So it has been a pleasant surprise to have healthy dinners that actually we all can enjoy thanks to the recipes from this book!

I find that for my wife I am a lot stricter than the book outlines because of the real battle she is having with her sugar. Some of the recipes have to be modified but the overall approach is a good starting point for someone who needs the help like me.

all_review.text: Book is definitely great with recipes for Diabetics. I hate the fact that there are almost no pictures of the dishes being prepared. A few pics here and there. I'm a visual person, I need to see what I'm making. Words and measures do not speack to me until I see the final product. Some recipes are very good so that is a plus.

all_review.title: Each recipe takes way too many ingredients and not ones ...

all_review.title: Great cookbook!

all_review.text: Excellent book of recipes for the diabetic. The tomato soup was awesome, May great soups, desserts and poultry recipes and easy to follow. I only wish it was recipes for two instead of four or more... I sometimes get challenged when trying to cut a recipe in half...

all_review.text: This book has saved me! Now my husband and I can share all the comfort foods we want and never again does he have to feel like he is missing out on something.

all_review.title: Yes you can still have your favorite foods with just a few modifications!!!

Although geared toward a diabetic watching their carb count, they are delicious meals you can make for the whole family. Recommed the book highly.

all_review.title: I'm not diabetic but I love this cookbook.
